lines.gurmukhi: 1 siqgur mihmw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaar 15

Shabad OS B.translation: Vaar 15

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy realised through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru scw pwiqswhu kUVy bwidswh dunIAwvy
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Sachaa Paatisaahu Koorhay Baadisaah Douneeaavay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru (God) is the true emperor; all other worldly kinds are fake ones.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru nwQw nwQu hY hoie nauN nwQ AnwQ inQwvy
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Naadaa Naadu Hai Hoi Naoun Naad Anaad Nidaavay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the Lord of lords; the nine naths (members and heads of ascetic yogi orders) are refugeless and without any master.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru scu dwqwr hY horu dwqy iPrdy pwCwvy
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Sachu Daataaru Hai Horu Daatay Dhiraday Paachhaavay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the true bestower; other donors just move after Him.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru krqw purKu hY kir krqUiq innwvin nwvy
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Karataa Purakhu Hai Kari Karatooti Ninaavani Naavay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the creator and makes the unknown famous by giving them the name (naam).

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru scw swhu hY horu swh vyswh aucwvy
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Sachaa Saahu Hai Horu Saah Avaysaah Ouchaavay.

Shabad OS B.translation: True Guru is the real banker; other rich person’s cannot be believed.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru scw vYdu hY horu vYdu sB kYd kUVwvy
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Sachaa Vaidu Hai Horu Vaidu Sabh Kaid Koorhaavay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the true physician; others themselves are imprisoned in the false bondage of transmigration.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu siqguru siB ingoswvY ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Satiguru Sabhi Nigosaavai ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the true Guru they all are without the guiding force.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 Eho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Praise of the true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur qIrQu jwxIAY ATsiT qIrQ srxI Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Teeradu Jaaneeai Atdasatdi Teerad Saranee Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is that pilgrimages centre in whose shelter are the sixty-eight pilgrimage centres of the Hindus.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru dyau AByau hY horu dyv guru syv qrwey
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Dayu Abhayu Hai Horu Dayv Guru Sayv Taraaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being beyond dualities, the true a Guru is the supreme God and other gods get across the world ocean only by serving Him.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru pwris prisAY lK pwrs pwKwku suhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Paarasi Parasiai Lakh Paaras Paa Khaaku Suhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is that philosopher's stone the dust of whose feet adorns millions of philosopher's stones.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru pUrw pwirjwqu pwrjwq lK sPil iDAwey
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Pooraa Paarijaatu Paarajaat Lakh Saphal Dhiaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is that perfect wish-fulfilling tree who is meditated upon by the millions of wish-fulfilling trees.

lines.gurmukhi: suK swgru siqgur purKu rqn pdwrQ isK suxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Soukh Saagar Satigur Purakhu Ratan Padaarad Sikh Sounaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru being ocean of delights distributes pearls in the form of different sermons.

lines.gurmukhi: icMqwmix siqgur crx icMqwmxI AicMq krwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chintaamani Satigur Charan Chintaamanee Achint Karaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The feet of the true Guru are that desire fulfilling fabulous gem (chintamani) which makes myriads of gems free of anxieties.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu siqgur siB dUjy Bwey ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Satigur Sabhi Doojai Bhaaay ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Except the true Guru (God) all other is duality (which makes one go the cycle of transmigration).

lines.gurmukhi: 3 mwns dyh dI auqpqI

Shabad OS B.translation: Origin of the Human body

lines.gurmukhi: lK caurwsIh jUin ivic auqmu jUin su mwxs dyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Vichi Outamu Jooni Su Maanas Dayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Out of the eighty-four lakh species, the human life is the best one.

lines.gurmukhi: AKI dyKY ndir kir ijhbw bolY bcn ibdyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Daykhai Nadari Kari Jihabaa Bolay Bachan Bidayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: By his eyes man beholds and with his tongue he eulogises God.

lines.gurmukhi: kMnI suxdw suriq kir vws ley nik sws snyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Kannee Sounadaa Surati Kari Vaas Laay Naki Saas Sanayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: By ears he listens carefully and smells lovingly by his nose.

lines.gurmukhi: hQI ikriq kmwvxI pYrI clxu joiq ievyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Hadee Kirati Kamaavanee Pairee Chalanu Joti Ivayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: By hands he earns livelihood and moves by the power of feet.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK jnmu skwrQw mnmuK mUriq miq iknyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Janamu Sakaaradaa Manamoukh Moorati Mati Kinayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In this species, the life of a gurmukh is successful but how is the thinking of manmukh, the mind-orientated one ? The thinking of the manmukh is evil.

lines.gurmukhi: krqw purKu ivswirkY mwxs dI min Aws DryhI
lines.transliteration_english: Karataa Purakhu Visaari Kai Maanas Dee Mani Aas Dharayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukh, forgetting the Lord goes on pinning his hopes upon men.

lines.gurmukhi: psU pryqhu burI buryhI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Pasoo Paraytahu Buree Hurayhee ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: His body is worse than then animals’ and the ghosts’.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 bMdy dw bMdw, mnmuK dI dSw

Shabad OS B.translation: Slave of the man;the position of the manmukh  ,

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur swihbu Cif kY mnmuK hoie bMdy dw bMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Saahibu Chhadi Kai Manamoukhu Hoi Banday Daa Bandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukh, the mind-orientated, leaving away the true Guru Lord becomes slave of man.

lines.gurmukhi: hukmI bMdw hoie kY inq auiT jwie slwmu krMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Houkamee Bandaa Hoi Kai Nit Outdi Jaai Salaam Karandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming errand boy of man he goes daily to salute him.

lines.gurmukhi: AwT phr hQ joiV kY hoie hjUrI KVw rhMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Aatd Pahar Had Jorhi Kai Hoi Hajooree Kharhaa Rahandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the twenty four hours (eight pahars) with folded hands he stands before his master.

lines.gurmukhi: nId n BuK n suK iqsu sUlI cViHAw rhY frMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Need N Bhoukh N Soukh Tisu Soolee Charhhiaa Rahai Darandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sleep, hunger and pleasure he does not have and remains so scared as if he has been sacrificed.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI pwlw Dup Cwau isr auqY Jil duK shMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Paalaa Dhoup Chhaau Sir Outai Jhali Doukh Sahandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Throughout rains, cold, sunlight, shade, he undergoes myriad sufferings.

lines.gurmukhi: Awqs bwjI swru vyiK rx ivic Gwielu hoie mrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Aatasabaajee Saaru Vaykhi Ran Vichi Ghaailu Hoi Marandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the battlefield (of life) this same person, considering sparks of iron as fireworks gets mortally wounded.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu jUin BvMdw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Jooni Bhavandaa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the (shelter of) perfect Guru, he wanders through the species.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 kMn-pwitAwN dw hwl

Shabad OS B.translation: Condition of the split-ears-

lines.gurmukhi: nwQwN nwQu n syvnI hoie AnwQ gurU bhu cyly
lines.transliteration_english: Naadaan Naadu N Sayvanee Hoi Anaadu Guroo Bahu Chaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Not serving the Lord (God) of Lords, many lords (naths) becoming gurus initiate people as their disciples.

lines.gurmukhi: kMn pVwie ibBUiq lwie iKMQw Kpru fMfw hyly
lines.transliteration_english: Kann Parhaai Bibhooti Laai Khindaa Khaparu Dandaa Haylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They getting the ears split and applying ashes on their bodies carry begging bowls and staff.

lines.gurmukhi: Gir Gir tukr mMgdy isM|I nwdu vwjwiein Byly
lines.transliteration_english: Ghari Ghari Toukar Mangaday Sinee Naadu Vaajaaini Bhaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Going from door to door, they beg food and blow their singi, a special instrument made of horn.

lines.gurmukhi: Bugiq ipAwlw vMfIAY isiD swiDk isvrwqI myly
lines.transliteration_english: Bhougati Piaalaa Vandeeai Sidhi Saadhik Sivaraatee Maylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting together on the Sivaratri fair they share with one another the food and the cup of drinks.

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh pMQ clwiedy bwrh vwtI Kry duhyly
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Pand Chalaaiday Baarah Vaatee Kharay Duhaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They follow one of the twelve sects (of yogis) and go on moving on these twelve ways i.e. they go on transmigrating.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu gur sbd n isJnI bwjIgr kir bwjI Kyly
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Sabad N Sijhanee Baajeegar Kari Baajee Khaylay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the word of the Guru, none gets liberated and all of them run here and there like acrobats.

lines.gurmukhi: AMnHY AMnHw KUhI Tyly ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Annhai Annhaa Khoohee Tdaylay ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way the blind one goes on pushing the blind into the well.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 pUry gurU bwJ roxw

Shabad OS B.translation: Weeping and wailing without the perfect Guru

lines.gurmukhi: scu dwqwru ivswrkY mMgiqAwN no mMgx jwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Daataaru Visaar Kai Mangatiaan No Mangan Jaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Forgetting the true bestower, people spread their hands before the beggars.

lines.gurmukhi: FwFI vwrwN gwvdy vYr ivroD joD swlwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Ddhaaddhee Vaaraan Gaanvaday Vair Virodh Jodh Saalaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The bards sing of the brave works pertaining to the brave and eulogise the duels and enmities of the warriors.

lines.gurmukhi: nweI gwvin s`dVy kir krqUiq muey bdrwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Naaee Gaavani Sadarhay Kari Karatooti Mooay Badaraahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The barbers also sing the praises of those who have died treading evil path and committing evil deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: pVdy Bt kivq kir kUV kusqu muKhu AlwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Parhaday Bhat Kavit Kari Koorh Kousatu Moukhahi Aalaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The eulogisers recite poetry for false kings and go on telling lies.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie As rIiq purohqw pRIiq prIqY ivriq mMgwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Asirit Purohitaa Preeti Pareetai Virati Mangaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The priests first seek shelter but afterwards lay their claim of bread and butter i.e. they entangle people in the fear of the net of ritualism.

lines.gurmukhi: CurIAw mwrin pMKIey hit hit mMgdy iBK BvwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhureeaa Maarani Pankheeay Hati Hati Mangaday Bhikh Bhavaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The people belonging to the sects of persons wearing feathers on their heads punch their bodies with knives and go on begging from shop to shop.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu rovin DwhI ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Rovani Dhaahee ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: But without the perfect Guru, they all wail and weep bitterly.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 JUTy swk

Shabad OS B.translation: The fake relations

lines.gurmukhi: krqw purKu n cyiqE kIqy no krqw kir jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Karataa Purakhu N Chaytiao Keetay No Karataa Kari Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: O man, you have not remembered the creator and have accepted the created as your creator.

lines.gurmukhi: nwir Bqwir ipAwru kir puqu poqw ipau dwdu vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Naari Bhataari Piaaru Kari Poutu Potaa Piu Daadu Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting engrossed in wife or husband you have further created relationships of son, grandson, father and grandfather.

lines.gurmukhi: DIAw BYxw mwxu kir qusin rusin swk bbwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Dheeaa Bhainaa Maanu Kari Tousani Rousani Saak Babaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Daughters and sisters proudly become happy or annoyed and such is the case of all relatives.

lines.gurmukhi: sIhuru pIhuru nwnky prvwrY swDwru iD|wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Saahur Peeharu Naanakay Paravaarai Saadhaaru Dhiaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: All other relation's such as the house of father-in-law, one's mother's house, the house of the maternal uncles and other relations of the family are disdainful.

lines.gurmukhi: cj Acwr vIcwr ivic pMcw AMdir piq prvwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Chaj Achaar Veechaar Vichi Panchaa Andari Pati Paravaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If conduct and thoughts are civilised, one gets honour before the high ups of the society.

lines.gurmukhi: AMqkwl jmjwl ivic swQI koie n hoie is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Ant Kaal Jam Jaal Vichi Saadee Koi N Hoi Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: However, at the end, when caught up in the web of death, no companion takes notice of the person.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu jwie jmwxY ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Jaai Jamaanai ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Bereft of the grace of the perfect Guru, all persons become scared of death.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 JUTy vpwrI

Shabad OS B.translation: False merchants

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru swhu AQwhu Cif kUVy swhu kUVy vxjwry
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Saahu Adaahu Chhadi Koorhay Saahu Koorhay Vanajaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Except the infinite true Guru all other bankers and traders are false.

lines.gurmukhi: saudwgr saudwgrI GoVy vxj krin Aiq Bwry
lines.transliteration_english: Saudaagar Saudaagaree Ghorhay Vanaj Karani Ati Bhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The merchants trade heavily in horses.

lines.gurmukhi: rqnw prK jvwhrI hIry mwxk vxj pswry
lines.transliteration_english: Ratanaa Parakh Javaaharee Heeray Maanak Vanaj Pasaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The jewellers test the jewels and through diamonds and rubies spread their business.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie srwP bjwj bhu suienw rupw kpVu qwry
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Saraadh Bajaaj Bahu Suinaa Roupaa Kaparhu Bhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gold merchants deal in gold and cash and drapers deal in clothes.

lines.gurmukhi: ikrswxI ikrswx kir bIj luxin bohl ivsQwry
lines.transliteration_english: Kirasaanee Kirasaan Kari Beej Lounani Bohal Visadaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Farmers undertake farming and sowing seed cut it afterwards and makes it big heaps.

lines.gurmukhi: lwhw qotw vru srwpu kir sMjogu ivjogu ivcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Laahaa Totaa Varu Saraapu Kari Sanjogu Vijogu Vichaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: In all this business, profit, loss, boon, cure, meeting, separation goes hand in hand.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu duKu sYNswry ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Doukhu Sainsaaray ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the perfect Guru there is nothing in this world except suffering.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 JUTy vYd dI vYdgI

Shabad OS B.translation: Exceptthe perfect Guru all physicians are fake

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru vYdu n syivE rogI vYdu n rogu imtwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Soutiguru Vaidu N Sayviao Rogee Vaidu N Rogu Mitaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true physician in the form of true Guru (God) has never been served; then how could a physician who himself is diseased remove the malady of others?

lines.gurmukhi: kwm kRoDu ivic loBu mohu duibDw kir kir DRohu vDwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Krodhu Vichi Lobhu Mohu Doubidhaa Kari Kari Dhrohu Vadhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: These worldly physicians who themselves are engrossed in the lust, anger, greed, infatuation, deceive people and enhance their diseases.

lines.gurmukhi: AwiD ibAwiD aupwiD ivic mir mir jMmY duiK ivhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aadhi Biaadhi Oupaadhi Vichi Mari Mari Janmai Doukhi Vihaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: This way man involved in these ailments goes on transmigrating and remains full of suffering.

lines.gurmukhi: AwvY jwie BvweIAY Bvjl AMdir pwru n pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aavai Jaai Bhavaaeeai Bhavajal Andari Paaru N Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He goes stray by coming and going and becomes unable to go across the world-ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: Awsw mnsw mohxI qwmsu iqsnw swNiq n AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aasaa Manasaa Mohanee Taamasu Tisanaa Saanti N Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hopes and desires always attract his mind and being guided by evil propensities he never attains peace.

lines.gurmukhi: bldI AMdir qylu pwie ikau mnu mUrKu Aig buJwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Baladee Andari Taylu Paai Kiu Manu Moorakhu Agi Bujhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How could a manmukh extinguish fire by putting oil on it?

lines.gurmukhi: guru pUry ivxu kauxu CufwvY ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Pooray Vinu Kaounu Chhudaavai ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Who except the perfect Guru can liberate man from these bondage's?

lines.gurmukhi: 10 JUTy qIrQ

Shabad OS B.translation: Fake pilgrimage centres

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru qIrQu Cif kY AiTsiT qIrQ nwvx jwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Teeradu Chhadi Kai Atdisatdi Teerad Naavan Jaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Leaving aside pilgrimage centre in the form of the true Guru (God) people go to take bath at the sixty-eight holy places.

lines.gurmukhi: bgul smwiD lgwiekY ijau jl jMqwN Guit Guit KwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Bagul Samaadhi Lagaai Kai Jiu Jal Jantaan Ghouti Ghouti Khaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like crane, they keep their eyes closed in trance but they catch hold of small creatures, press them hard and eat them.

lines.gurmukhi: hsqI nIir nvwlIAin bwhir inkil Kyh aufwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Hasatee Neeri Navaaleeani Baahari Nikali Khayh Udaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Elephant is given bath in water, but coming out of water it again spreads dust on its body.

lines.gurmukhi: ndI n fubY qUMbVI qIrQu ivsu invwrY nwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Nadee N Doubai Toonbarhee Teeradu Visu Nivaarai Naahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Colocynth does not drown in water and even baths at many pilgrimage centres do not let its poison go.

lines.gurmukhi: pQru nIr pKwlIAY iciq kToru n iBjY kwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Padaru Neer Pakhaaleeai Chiti Katdoru N Bhijai Gaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Stone put and washed in water remains hard as before and water does not get inside it.

lines.gurmukhi: mnmuK Brm n auqrY BMBlBUsy Kwie BvwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Manamoukh Bharam N Outarai Bhanbhalabhoosay Khaai Bhavaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The illusions and doubts of the mind orientated, manmukh, never come to an end and he always wanders in dubiety.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu pwr n pwhI ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Pooray Vinu Paar N Paahee ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the perfect Guru none can go across the world-ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 siqgurU pwrs

Shabad OS B.translation: True Guru is philosopher's stone

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur pwrsu prhrY pQru pwrsu FUMFx jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Paarasu Paraharai Padaru Paarasu Ddhoonddhan Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Leaving aside the philosophers stone in the form of the true Guru, people go on searching the material philosopher's stone.

lines.gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu iek Dwqu kir lukdw iPrY n pRgtI Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dhaatu Ik Dhaatu Kari Loukadaa Dhirai N Pragatee Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru who can transform eight metals into gold in fact keeps himself hidden and does not get noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: lY vxvwsu audwsu hoie mwieAwDwrI Brim Bulwey
lines.transliteration_english: Lai Vanavaasu Udaasu Hoi Maaiaadhaaree Bharami Bhulaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mammon-orientated person searches him in forests and gets disappointed in many illusions.

lines.gurmukhi: hQI kwlK CuiQAw AMdir kwlK loB luBwey
lines.transliteration_english: Hadee Kaalakh Chhudiaa Andari Kaalakh Lobh Loubhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The touch of riches blackens one's outside and the mind is also smeared by it.

lines.gurmukhi: rwj fMfu iqsu pkiVAw jmpuir BI jmfMfu shwey
lines.transliteration_english: Raaj Dandu Tisu Pakarhiaa Jam Puri Bhee Jam Dandu Sahaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Catching hold of wealth makes one liable to public punishment here and to punishment by the lord of death there in his abode.

lines.gurmukhi: mnmuK jnmu AkwrQw dUjY Bwie kudwie hrwey
lines.transliteration_english: Manamoukh Janamu Akaaradaa Doojai Bhaai Kudaai Haraaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Futile is the birth of mind orientated; he getting engrossed in duality plays the wrong dice and loses the game of life.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu Brmu n jwey ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Bharamu N Jaaay ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Illusion cannot be removed without the perfect Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 gur klp biR`C

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru, the wish fulfilling tree

lines.gurmukhi: pwirjwq guru Cif kY mMgin klpqroN Pl kcy
lines.transliteration_english: Paarijaatu Guru Chhadi Kai Mangani Kalap Taron Phal Kachay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Leaving the wish-fulfilling tree in the form of Guru, people desire to have the raw fruits of traditional wish-fulfilling tree (kalptaru/parijat).

lines.gurmukhi: pwrjwq lK surg sxu Awvwgvxu Bvx ivic pcy
lines.transliteration_english: Paarajaatu Lakh Suragu Sanu Aavaa Gavanu Bhavan Vichi Pachay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of parijat along with heavens are getting perished in the cycle of transmigration.

lines.gurmukhi: mrdy kir kir kwmnw idiq Bugiq ivic ric ivrcy
lines.transliteration_english: Maraday Kari Kari Kaamanaa Diti Bhougati Vichi Rachi Virachay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Controlled by desires people are perishing and are busy in enjoying whatever has been bestowed by the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: qwry hoie Agws ciV EVik quit quit Qwn hlcy
lines.transliteration_english: Taaray Hoi Agaas Charhi Aorhaki Turhi Turhi Daan Halachay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man of good actions establish in the sky in the form of stars and after exhausting the results of virtues again become falling stars.

lines.gurmukhi: mwN ipau hoey kyqVy kyqiVAwN dy hoey bcy
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Piu Hoay Kaytarhay Kaytarhiaan Day Hoay Bachay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Again through transmigration they become mothers and fathers and many beget children.

lines.gurmukhi: pwp puMn bIau bIjdy duK suK Pl AMdir chmcy
lines.transliteration_english: Paap Pounnu Beeu Beejaday Doukh Soukh Phal Andari Chahamachay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Further sowing evils and virtues remain immersed in pleasures and sufferings.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu hir n prcy ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Hari N Parachay ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the perfect Guru, God cannot be made happy.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Without true Guru hard times are there

lines.gurmukhi: suK swgru guru Cif kY Bvjl AMdir BMBlBUsy
lines.transliteration_english: Soukhu Saagaru Guroo Chhadi Kai Bhavajal Andari Bhanbhalabhoosay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Leaving the Guru, the Pleasure Ocean, one tosses up and down in the world-ocean of delusions and deceptions.

lines.gurmukhi: lhrI nwil pCwVIAin haumY AgnI AMdr lUsy
lines.transliteration_english: Laharee Naali Pachhaarheeani Haoumai Aganee Andari Loosay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The stroke of the waves of the world-ocean tosses and the fire of ego continuously burns the inner self.

lines.gurmukhi: jm dir bDy mwrIAin jmdUqw dy Dky DUsy
lines.transliteration_english: Jam Dari Badhay Maareeani Jamadootaan Day Dhakay Dhoosay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tied and beaten at the door of death, one receives the kicks of the messengers of death.

lines.gurmukhi: goieil vwsw cwir idn nwau Drwiein eIsy mUsy
lines.transliteration_english: Goili Vaasaa Chaari Din Naau Dharaaini Eesay Moosay.

Shabad OS B.translation: May be some one has named himself after Christ or Moses, but in this world all are to stay for a few days.

lines.gurmukhi: Git n koie AKwiedw Awpo DwpI hYrq hUsy
lines.transliteration_english: Ghati N Koi Akhaaidaa Aapo Paapee Hairat Hoosay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Here none deems himself lesser one and all are engrossed in the rat race for selfish ends to find themselves shocked ultimately.

lines.gurmukhi: swier dy mrjIvVy krin mjUrI Kycl KUsy
lines.transliteration_english: Saair Day Marajeevarhay Karani Majooree Khaychal Khoosay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who are divers of the pleasure-ocean existing in the form of Guru, only they remain happy in the labour (of spiritual discipline).

lines.gurmukhi: guru pUry ivxu fwNg fMgUsy ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Guroo Pooray Vinu Daang Dangoosay ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the true Guru, all are always at loggerheads.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 BogwN nwl A`g vDy hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Enjoyments increase fire of lust

lines.gurmukhi: icMqwmix guru Cif kY icMqwmix icMqw n gvwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chintaamani Guru Chhadi Kai Chintaamani Chintaa N Gavaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The traditional wish fulfilling fabulous gem (chintamani) cannot remove anxiety if one could not cultivate the Guru, chintamani.

lines.gurmukhi: icqvxIAw lK rwiq idhu qRws n qiRsnw Agin buJwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chitavaneeaa Lakh Raati Dihu Traas N Trisanaa Agani Bujhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many hopes and disappointments scare man day in and day out and the fire of desires it never quenched.

lines.gurmukhi: suienw rupw Aglw mwxk moqI AMig hMFwey
lines.transliteration_english: Suinaa Roupaa Agalaa Maanak Motee Angi Handdhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Plenty of gold, wealth, rubies and pearls are worn by man.

lines.gurmukhi: pwt ptMbr pYnH ky coAw cMdn mih mhkwey
lines.transliteration_english: Paat Patanbar Painh Kay Choaa Chandan Mahi Mahakaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wearing silken garment scatters around the fragrance of sandal etc.

lines.gurmukhi: hwQI GoVy pwKry mhl bgIcy suPl Plwey
lines.transliteration_english: Haadee Ghorhay Paakharay Mahal Bageechay Suphal Phalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man keeps elephants, horses, palaces, and fruit laden gardens.

lines.gurmukhi: suMdr nwrI syj suK mwieAw moih Doih lptwey
lines.transliteration_english: Soundari Naaree Sayj Soukhu Maaiaa Mohi Dhohi Lapataaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Enjoying the pleasure-giving bed along with beautiful women, he remains engrossed in many deceptions and infatuations.

lines.gurmukhi: bldI AMdir qyl ijau Awsw mnsw duiK ivhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Baladee Andari Taylu Jiu Aasaa Manasaa Doukhi Vihaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They all are fuels to the fire and man spends life in the sufferings of hopes and desires

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu jmpuir jwey ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Jam Puri Jaaay ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: He has to reach the abode of Yama (death god) if he remains without the perfect Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 kudrq dw vrxn

Shabad OS B.translation: Describing the creation

lines.gurmukhi: lK qIrQ lK dyvqy pwrs lK rswiexu jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Teerad Lakh Dayvatay Paaras Lakh Rasaainu Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions are pilgrimage centres and so are the gods, the philosopher's stones and chemicals.

lines.gurmukhi: lK icMqwmix pwrjwq kwmDynu lK AMmiRq AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Chintaamani Paarajaat Kaamadhaynu Lakh Anmrit Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions are chintamanis, wish fulfilling trees and cows, and nectars are also there numbering millions.

lines.gurmukhi: rqnw sxu swier Gxy iriD isiD iniD soBw sulqwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Ratanaa Sanu Saair Ghanay Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Sobhaa Sulataanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Oceans with pearls, miraculous powers and the adorable kinds are also many.

lines.gurmukhi: lK pdwrQ lK Pl lK inDwn AMdir PurmwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Padaarad Lakh Phal Lakh Nidhaanu Andari Phuramaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Materials, fruits and stores to be present to order are also millions in number.

lines.gurmukhi: lK swh pwiqswh lK lK nwQ Avqwru suhwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Saah Paatisaah Lakh Lakh Naad Avataaru Suhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bankers, emperors, naths and grand incarnations are also myriads in number.

lines.gurmukhi: dwnY kImiq nw pvY dwqY kauxu sumwru vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Daanai Keemati Naa Pavai Daatai Kaounu Soumaaru Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When charities bestowed cannot be evaluated, how can one describe the extent of the bestower.

lines.gurmukhi: kudriq kwdr no kurbwxY ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Kudarati Kaadar No Kurabaanai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: This whole creation is sacrifice unto that creator Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 gurU cylw, cylw gurU

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru-Disiple and disciple-Guru ,

lines.gurmukhi: rqnw dyKY sBu ko rqn pwrKU ivrlw koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Ratanaa Daykhai Sabhu Ko Ratan Paarakhoo Viralaa Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The jewels are beholden by all but the jeweller is any rare one who test checks the jewels.

lines.gurmukhi: rwg nwd sB ko suxY sbd suriq smJY ivrloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Raag Naad Sabh Ko Sounai Sabad Surati Samajhai Viraloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All listen to the melody and rhythm but a rare one understands the mystery of Word consciousness,

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK rqn pdwrQwN swDsMgiq imil mwl proeI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Ratan Padaaradaa Saadhasangati Mili Maal Paroee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs of the Guru are pearls who are strung in the garland in the form of congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: hIrY hIrw byiDAw sbd suriq imil prcw hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Heerai Heeraa Baydhiaa Sabad Surati Mili Parachaa Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only his consciousness remains merged in the Word whose mind diamond remains cut by the diamond of Word, the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHmu guru goivMdu is\\\\wxY soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Guru Govindu Siaanai Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fact that the transcendental Brahm is the prefect Brahm and the Guru is God, is only identified by a gurmukh, the Guru-orientated one.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPlu shij Gru iprm ipAwlw jwxu jxoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukhaphalu Sahaji Gharu Piram Piaalaa Jaanu Janoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only gurmukhs enter the abode of inner knowledge to attain fruits of delight and only they know the delight of the cup of love and make others also know it.

lines.gurmukhi: guru cylw cylw gur hoeI ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guru Hoee ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Then the Guru and the disciple become identical.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 AMgwN dI sPlqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Utility of the organs

lines.gurmukhi: mwxs jnmu Amolu hY hoie Amolu swDsMg pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Janamu Amolu Hai Hoi Amolu Saadhasangu Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Human life is invaluable and by being born man gets the company of the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: AKI duie inrmolkw siqgur drs iDAwn ilvlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Dui Niramolakaa Satiguru Daras Dhiaan Liv Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Both the eyes are invaluable who behold the true Guru and concentrating upon the Guru remain immersed in Him.

lines.gurmukhi: msqku sIs Amolu hY crx srx guru DUiV suhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Masataku Seesu Amolu Hai Charan Sarani Guru Dhoorhi Suhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The forehead is also invaluable which remaining in the shelter of the feet of the Guru adorns itself with the dust of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: ijhbw sÍx Amolkw sbd suriq suix smiJ suxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jihabaa Sravan Amolakaa Sabad Surati Souni Samajhi Sounaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tongue and ears are also invaluable which carefully understanding and listening to the Word make other people also understand and listen.

lines.gurmukhi: hsq crx inrmolkw gurmuK mwrig syv kmwey
lines.transliteration_english: Hasat Charan Niramolakaa Guramoukh Maaragi Sayv Kamaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hands and feet are also invaluable which move on the way of becoming gurmukh and perform service.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK irdw Amolu hY AMdir guru aupdysu vswey
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Ridaa Amolu Hai Andari Guru Oupadaysu Vasaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Invaluable is the heart of gurmukh wherein resides the teaching of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: piq prvwxY qoil qulwey ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Pati Paravaanai Toli Tulaaay ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Whosoever becomes equal to such gurmukhs, is respected in the court of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 r`b dIAwN dwqwN qy swfI Bu`l

Shabad OS B.translation: Gifts of the Lord and our mistakes

lines.gurmukhi: rkqu ibMd kir inimAw icqR cilqR bicqR bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Rakatu Bindu Kari Nimiaa Chitr Chalitr Bachitr Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From the blood of mother and semen of father the human body was created and the Lord accomplished this wonderful feat.

lines.gurmukhi: grB kuMf ivic riKAw jIaupwie qnu swij suhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Garabh Kound Vichi Rakhiaa Jeeu Paai Tanu Saaji Suhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This human body was kept in the well of the womb. Then life was infused in it and its grandeur was further enhanced.

lines.gurmukhi: muhu AKI dy nku kMn hQ pYr dMd vwl gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Muhu Akhee Day Naku Kann Had Pair Dand Vaal Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mouth, eyes, nose, ears, hands, teeth, hair etc. were bestowed upon it.

lines.gurmukhi: idsit sbd giq surq ilv rwg rMg rs prs luBwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Disati Sabad Gati Surati Livai Raag Rang Ras Par Salu Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man was given sight, speech, power of listening and consciousness of merging in the Word. For his ears, eyes, tongue and skin, the form, joy, smell etc. were created.

lines.gurmukhi: auqmu kulu auqmu jnmu rom rom gix AMg bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Outamu Kulu Outamu Janamu Rom Rom Gani Ang Sabaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By giving the best family (of human being) and birth in it, the Lord god gave shape to one and all organs.

lines.gurmukhi: bwlbuiD muih duiD dy kir ml mUqR sUqR ivic AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baalabudhi Muhi Dudhi Day Kari Mal Mootr Sootr Vichi Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: During infancy, mother pours milk into the mouth and make (the baby) defecate.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie isAwxw smiJAw krqw Cif kIqy lptwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Siaanaa Samajhiaa Karataa Chhadi Keetay Lapataaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When grown up, he (man) leaving aside the creator Lord becomes engrossed with His creation.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu moihAw mwieAw ]28]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Mohiaa Maaiaa ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the perfect Guru, man goes on to be engrossed into the web of maya.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 gurU bwJ grB vws

Shabad OS B.translation: Without Guru, the goings and comings continue

lines.gurmukhi: mnmuK mwxs dyh qy psU pryq Acyq cMgyry
lines.transliteration_english: Manamoukh Maanas Dayh Tay Pasoo Parayt Achayt Changayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Animals and ghosts said to be without wisdom are better than manmukh the mind-orientated.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie sucyq Acyq hoie mwxsu mwxsu dy vil hyry
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Souchayt Achayt Hoi Maanasu Maanas Day Vali Hayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even being wise the man becomes fool and goes on looking towards men (to meet his selfish ends).

lines.gurmukhi: psU n mMgY psU qy pMKyrU pMKyrU Gyry
lines.transliteration_english: Pasoo N Mangai Pasoo Tay Pankhayroo Pankhayroo Ghayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: An animal from animals and a bird from birds never ask for anything.

lines.gurmukhi: caurwsI lK jUin ivic auqm mwxs jUin Blyry
lines.transliteration_english: Chauraaseeh Lakh Jooni Vichi Outam Maanas Jooni Bhalayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among eighty-four lakh species of life, the human life is the best one.

lines.gurmukhi: auqm mn bc krm kir jnmu mrx Bvjl lK Pyry
lines.transliteration_english: Outam Man Bach Karam Kari Janamu Maran Bhavajalu Lakh Dhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having even the best mind, speech and actions, man goes on transmigtraing in the ocean of life and death.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjw prjw hoie kY suK ivic duKu hoie Bly Blyry
lines.transliteration_english: Raajaa Parajaa Hoi Kai Soukh Vichi Doukhu Hoi Bhalay Bhalayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whether it is a king or the people, even the good persons suffer the fear (of going away) from pleasure.

lines.gurmukhi: kuqw rwj bhwlIAY ckI ctx jwie AnHyry
lines.transliteration_english: Koutaa Raaj Bahaaleeai Chakee Chatan Jaai Anhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dog, even if enthroned, according to its basic nature goes on to lick the flourmill at the fall of darkness.

lines.gurmukhi: gur pUry ivxu grB vsyry ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Pooray Vinu Garabh Vasayray ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the perfect Guru one has to stay in the abode of womb i.e. the transmigration never ends.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 gurmuK bwJ rs nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: No joy without Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: vix vix vwsu vxwspiq cMdnu bwJu n cMdn hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Vani Vani Vaasu Vanaasapati Chandanu Baajhu N Chandanu Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The forests are replete with vegetation but without sandalwood, the fragrance of sandal does not occur in it.

lines.gurmukhi: prbiq prbiq AstDwqu pwrs bwJu n kMcnu soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Parabati Parabati Asat Dhaatu Paaras Baajhu N Kanchanu Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Minerals are there on all the mountain but without the philosopher's stone they do not transform into gold.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrix iCA drsnw swDsMgiq ivxu swD n koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varani Chhia Darasanaa Saadhasangati Vinu Saadhu N Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: None among the four varnas and the scholars of the six philosophies can become (true) sadhu without the company of saints.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdysu Avys kir gurmuiK swDsMgiq jwxoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Jaanoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Charged by the teachings of the Guru, gurmukhs understand the importance of the company of the saints.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv lIxu hoie iprm ipAwlw Aipau ipEeI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Leenu Hoi Piram Piaalaa Apiu Piaoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then, they getting the consciousness attuned to the Word, quaff the cup of nectar of loving devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: min aunmin qin dubly dyh ibdyh snyh sQoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Mani Ounamani Tani Doubalay Dayh Bidayh Sanayh Sadoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mind now reaching the highest stage of spiritual realisation (turiya) and becoming subtle stabilises in the love of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl AlK lKoeI ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakh Lakhoee ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs beholding the invisible Lord receive the fruits of that pleasure.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 mwieAw ivc audws

Shabad OS B.translation: Indifferent to maya

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu swDsMgu mwieAw AMdir krin audwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Saadhasangu Maaiaa Andari Karani Udaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gumukhs get pleasure in the company of saints. They remain indifferent to maya though they live in it.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau jl AMdir kvlu hY sUrj DRXwnu Agwsu invwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Jal Andari Kavalu Hai Sooraj Dhaanu Agaasu Nivaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As a lotus, which remains in water and yet keep its gaze fixed towards the sun, gurmukhs always keep their consciousness attuned to the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdnu spIN vyiVAw sIqlu swNiq sugMiD ivgwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandanu Sapeen Vayrhiaa Seetalu Saanti Sougandhi Vigaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sandalwood remains entwined by snakes but still it spreads cool and peace-producing fragrance all around.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq sMswr ivic sbd suriq ilv shij iblwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Sansaar Vichi Sabad Surati Liv Sahaji Bilaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs living in the world, through the company of the saints keeping the consciousness attuned to the Word, move around in equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: jog jugiq Bog Bugiq ijx jIvn mukiq ACl AibnwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Jog Jougati Bhog Bhougati Jini Jeevan Moukati Achhal Abinaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: They conquering the technique of yoga and bhog (enjoyment) become liberated in life, undecievable and indestructible.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrx bHmu gur prmysru Aws inrwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabraham Pooran Brahamu Gur Paramaysaru Aas Niraasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the transcendetal Brahm is the perfect Brahm , the same way the Guru who is indifferent to hopes and desires is also nothing but God.

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw Aibgiq prgwsI ]21]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Abigati Paragaasee ?21?15?pandraan?

Shabad OS B.translation: (Through the Guru) that ineffable story and unmenifest light of the Lord becomes known (to the world).

lines.gurmukhi: <> sqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realised through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl sÍwd ibsmwd Aiq AkQ kQw ibnod khq n AwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Svaad Bisamaad Ati , Akad Kadaa Binod Kahat N Aavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The spiritual happiness of a devout Sikh of Guru who meditates on Lord's name, the bliss and his spiritual happiness is wonderful beyond explanation.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiK suKPl gMD prmdBuq sIql koml prsq bin AwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmakhi Soukhaphal Gandh Paramadabhouta , Seetal Komal Parasat Bani Aavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The peace and joy of a Guru-conscious person diffuses wonderful fragrance. Its tranquility and softness can only be realised when it is relished. There is no limit of the divine peace and wisdom of such a Guru-oriented person. It can understood best when

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl mihmw AgwiD boD gur isK sMD imil AlK lKwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Mahimaa Agaadhi Bodha , Gur Sikh Sandh Mili Alakh Lakhaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who is a devout Sikh of Guru, the glory of his spiritual, knowledge gets reflected in every limb of his body umpteen times. Every hair of his body becomes alive with divine effulgence.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suKPl AMig AMig kot soBw mwieAw kY idKwvY so qo Anq n DwveI ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Angi Angi Kot Sobhaa , Maaiaa Kai Dikhaavai So To Anat N Dhaavaee ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: By his grace, whosoever is shown this state of spiritual bliss, does not wander about anywhere. (15)
